title: A30 motorist jailed for shooting a fellow driver during a road rage attack
title_page: A30 motorist jailed for shooting a fellow driver during a road rage attack | Daily Mail Online
text:
Omar Ilebiyi, 20, of Witney, Oxfordshire, was jailed after shooting another driver with a BB gun while driving at 60mph on the A30 in Devon
A man has been jailed for shooting a fellow driver during a road rage attack - while they were both travelling at sixty miles an hour.
Short-fused motorist Omar Ilebiyi, of Witney, Oxfordshire, was travelling on a dual carriageway when he aimed and fired his BB gun at the window of Jonathan James' van.
The pellet hit the terrified victim in the chest and caused glass to smash around him.
The court heard how Ilebiyi, 20, was reacting to what he perceived to be bad driving and picked up and fired his weapon after the victim had 'crossed his lane.'
Mr James served dramatically after being shot but miraculously avoided crashing and was able to regain control of his vehicle.
Sentencing Ilebiyi to 28 months in prison, Judge Christopher Harvey Clark, QC, told him: 'Your behaviour was almost unforgivable and could have had the most catastrophic results.
'In a moment of utter madness, you wound down the passenger side window and fired your BB gun at the other driver.'
Ilebiyi, who was living in Portreath, Cornwall at the time of the incident, admitted possessing a firearm with intent to cause fear of violence and common assault at Truro Crown Court.
Prosecuting, Philip Lee said both vehicles were travelling on the A30 near Okehampton, Devon, at around 6.30pm at a speed of between 55 and 60 mph.
Ilebiyi was in the overtaking lane and Mr James on the inside, when the shot was fired.
Mr Lee said: 'His van swerved to the nearside, though he was able to regain control of it.
'He was covered in glass, he noticed then that he had a stinging sensation in the left side of his chest.'
Ilebiyi, pictured with what is believed to be the gun he used to shoot Jonathan James through his van window
The stinging was caused by the pellet striking Mr James' body.
In a victim impact statement read to the court Mr James had described how the shooting had changed his life.
Mr Lee added: 'He relives the incident frequently.'
The court heard how when Ilebiyi was later arrested the gun remained loaded.
He claimed in interview that Mr James had crossed his lane and put his finger up at him, which angered him and caused him to pick up the gun.
The incident took place on the A30, pictured, near Okehampton, Devon, when Mr James 'crossed Ilebiyi's lane'
He also posted a picture on social media of himself posing with the gun that is believed to have been used during the incident.
Bob Linford, for the defence, said his client knew that whatever happened on the A30 and whatever the provocation, there was no excuse for doing what he did.
He said: 'He just momentarily, completely lost it.'
Mr Linford added the BB gun had been in Ilebiyi's car for a lawful reason - to shoot rats and rabbits.
